etymologies: early 19th century: coined in German, via French from Greek bios ‘life’+ -logy

definitions: the study of living organisms, divided into many specialized fields that cover their morphology, physiology, anatomy, behavior, origin, and distribution.
shortDefinitions: study of living organisms, divided into many specialized fields that cover their morphology, physiology, anatomy

definitions: the plants and animals of a particular area
shortDefinitions: plants and animals of particular area

definitions: the physiology, behavior, and other qualities of a particular organism or class of organisms
shortDefinitions: physiology, behaviour, and other qualities of particular organism or class of organisms
